II-C
Benefits: When injury shall wholly and continuously disable the
insured to the extent that he is prevented from performing every
duty of his occupation, he will be paid 50% of his base weekly
salary (at the time of his accident) subject to a maximum of $150
per week for the duration of the disability with a lifetime maximum.
In cases of disability caused by sickness, he will be paid 50% of
his base weekly salary subject to a maximum of $150 per week for
260 weeks, or to age 65, whichever occurs first. However, if
disability occurs after the insured’s 63rd birthday, and before his
65th birthday, the weekly indemnity will be paid for the period of
such disability, but not to exceed 104 weeks.
NOTE: Any questions about any of the above insurance plans should
be directed to the Vice President’s office.
Retirement Benefits
Each NAEB employee employed through the University of Illinois
becomes a participant in the University Retirement System. For such
employees the Association shall contribute to the Retirement System
such amounts as are required by the System: each such employee shall
likewise contribute the amount specified by the Retirement System.
Employees not employed through the University of Illinois are covered
by Social Security, with the Association and the employee making such
contributions as are required by law.
TIAA-CREF
Certain executives of the Association, designated by the NAEB Board
of Directors, will be eligible for inclusion under the TIAA-CREF
plan. Payments, which vary according to salaries, are made monthly
on a matching basis, with the employee and the NAEB each paying
one-half of the monthly contribution.
NOTE: According to a policy established by the Board of Directors
in 1959, the President and Vice President have each received an
increment of 8.477% of their base salary, in lieu of a retirement
plan. Since the institution of the TIAA-CREF plan for certain
executives (calling for a contribution by the Association) this added
increment is reduced by the amount of Association contribution to the
TIAA-CREF plan.
